Reviews.Title: “There is good news and there is bad news”
Reviews.Author: Nidawei
Reviews.Content: The location, price and cleanliness of this place cannot be beat. That said, it is spartan, at best, and some things need repair, like a window in the bathroom that will not shut properly.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointing.”
Reviews.Author: Maggie F
Reviews.Content: Well maybe there is one apartment that looks like the one on the website. We booked a three bedroom one but on arrival were told that it wasn't available. We ended up with a one bed and a two bed apartment both equally scruffy. The bathrooms looked like they hadn't been touched since the 1970's - turquoise suite and the tiles had been painted over. The bedding whilst clean was strange - a blanket wrapped up in a sheet. The building is very noisy - no double glazing. The location is great, and if you have good ear plugs and are in London for some sightseeing then it is a good base.

Reviews.Title: “We'd definitely stay here again”
Reviews.Author: Lesley H
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 12 nights. We initially had a one bedroom apartment which did have 2 less than comfortable chairs in the living area. While the apartment itself was a bit on the shabby side, the price (for central London) was good, and making our own breakfasts & some lunches gave us even more to spend. The Curzon Plaza is in a terrific location for, and close to a tube station, although we found we could walk to just about everything we wanted to see. When our daughter and grand-daughter joined us we moved to a huge 2 bedroom apartment which we were all extremely happy with. Both apartments we had were cleaned daily! Both the cleaning and reception staff were fantastic - very helpful, cheerful and accommodating.

Reviews.Title: “If you want to sleep get a room at the back”
Reviews.Author: kendo012
Reviews.Content: I have stayed twice at the Curzon Plaza in the past three weeks and while it is reasonable I would have to say - try a Premier Inn as they are cleaner, with aircon and better beds. To try and pass this off as 3 star is not right. The quality is not there and if you get a room at the front of the hotel good luck sleeping. The road goes all night with cars, motorbikes and lorries. Took me hours to get to sleep. The place is like taking a step back in time. The time warp is stuck in about 1940!! It really is not worth the £150 a night I have just had to pay. Only benefit is you have a small kitchen in central London so at least you can microwave that dinner!!! There's better out there trust me.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: denbrooks1
Reviews.Content: had a 1 bed apartment , the living/ dining room was huge , kitchen well equipt , bathroon with bath and shower , huge bedroom with plently of wardrobe space , the place was very clean but could do with a lick of paint . the only down side was the constance traffic noise but your are in the midle of london it is to be expected , would stay again

Reviews.Title: “Awful”
Reviews.Author: elnash
Reviews.Content: Checked in at 3 pm today. Room was Noisy,dirty and smelled weird, glass in window was cracked - felt like I had walked into a vacated squat. Luckily the job I went to do in Mayfair finished early so I was able to check out 5 hours later without having to stay the night. I am not picky - this place was bad !!

Reviews.Title: “Very far from the pretty images on their site!”
Reviews.Author: WiglafMoscow
Reviews.Content: Absolutely no correlation of price and quality. The room was barely furnished, and what furniture there was was either Ikea or cheap. Linoleum floor throughout. Flaking paint on the window-frames, cracked tiles in the bathroom. Strangely enough, there was no COLD water for the three days of my stay. Each day they promised to fix it, and each evening I found out that nothing had been done. The room was cold, and they only provided one thin blanket. When I asked for another, they had to go to look in the cellar for a long time, before returning with an ancient blanket that had seen much better days, and obviously hadn't had a clean since the day it was purchased. The only positive point of the hotel is its excellent location near Green Park and the underground.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Apartment!”
Reviews.Author: MikeW45
Reviews.Content: We were both very pleasantly surprised when we checked into the Curzon Plaza. Naz and the rest of the team were first class and upon arrival we were upgraded to a one bedroomed deluxe apartment which exceeded our expectations. The location was excellant as was value for money in such an exclusive location. My only crticism was that the corridors were slightly tired and the exterior apartment doors could be doing with being either replaced or refurbished . Would thoroughly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Refused to stay - shabby and dirty”
Reviews.Author: anorakheaven
Reviews.Content: Brought back memories of shabby and filthy student halls of residence. Accommodation of hostel and not hotel standard. Myself and four colleagues refused to stay here due to concerns over cleanliness and our personal security due to room doors and windows not closing properly.......Carpet stains, bathroom mould and general grime around skirting boards, all in good need of a clean with Cillit Bang and Bleach! We did not stay and resorted to alternative accommodation in the area - of a higher standard and equal cost! If only we had checked tripadvisor first. The disappointing fact was that the receptionist gave the impression that we weren't the first to express our dissatisfaction and refusal to stay. Overall a bad experience. This hostel(!) needs a complete refurbishment.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic value and a great location”
Reviews.Author: Kelvin20
Reviews.Content: The room has all you need: living room, full kitchen, and bathroom with a bath. It's really HUGE, you can put your stuff everywhere. And the price is very low for that location, a few steps from Piccadilly Circus. The staff is not the nicest one, but the hotel itself is superb!!

Reviews.Title: “ok would stay again.”
Reviews.Author: deenaross0
Reviews.Content: we booked this place as we was going to the us embassy and it was close. we had a studio room priced @ Â£94.00 the room was clean bath room looked new, it had the biggest bed ever & it was comfortable. it was basic but it was just a bed for the night its in a great location within walking distance to lots of sights. there is lots of coffee shops near & a mini supermarket. over all we would stay again for the odd night. i found the staff to be nice & helpfull, also they gave us a car park ticket that got us Â£30.00 deducted from the price (40)

Reviews.Title: “Spacious Accommodations in Downtown London”
Reviews.Author: NovaScotiaAnniero
Reviews.Content: We found this place through a friend and wow! Our room was a two bedroom, two bath, apartment at less than we would have paid for two bunks at a hostel. Great location (There is a Tesco Express just down the road for snacks and bevvies, and it is a quick walk to the park and to Victoria Station.

Reviews.Title: “Somebody came in our room during the night, scary!”
Reviews.Author: MarieLondres2011
Reviews.Content: Very convenient studio and the bed was most comfortable. The apartment was very old but everything worked fine. Unfortunately, we had nosy neighbours who were in and out of their room all night. At one point in the middle of the night, some of them managed to enter our room. Weâ€™ve been told after worth that the night doorman had given them the wrong key. It was a sleepless night for us, the last one before a full day travelling back home. We have to say that the two first nights were fine.

Reviews.Title: “Treasure in Mayfair”
Reviews.Author: Adult44
Reviews.Content: Considering that this is one of the most coveted locations in London and that you can walk a couple of blocks to most of the 5-Diamond rated hotels, this serviced flat hotel is a bargain. For little more than US$100/night, I had a large 2-room suite with a kitchenette. Yes, other reviewers are correct, the hotel has its flaws -- it's noisy (road), sorta tatty furniture, has no table lamps (feeling a bit prison-y) and has iffy pillows. But here's the thing, it's Mayfair and it's a steal, so buck up and spend Â£1 on ear plugs, fiddle with the lights and bring a pillow. You're golden and you're in MAYFAIR. There's a Tesco market on the same block so I could lay in breakfast without spending Â£20 for a bun and coffee elsewhere. I could also buy some lovely things at that 300-year-old cheese shop a few blocks away to savor during my stay. And with all the space in the room and money saved, I could stock up on what mattered, SHOPPING (the room cost less than one new shirt!). The staff is very helpful and responsive. I had a couple of issues with heat (too much) and a leaky shower but they were fixed quickly with no questions. For those looking for the Ritz, it's a 2 blocks and Â£500 a night away.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money & clean & not like some describe!”
Reviews.Author: Skiandwine
Reviews.Content: I am writing this because I disagree with some of the negative reviews on this site. Had I seen the reviews before booking I almost certainly would not have stayed there. The building is indeed old and a little tired but the room that I had was clean and comfortable and represented excellent value in an expensive part of London. There is a policy of upgrades if available and we were given an upgrade from studio to 1 bed room apartment. The decor was a little old fashioned but very clean. This was, for me, a much better place to stay than an expensive hotel. We paid Â£121 for one night by booking 2 weeks in advance. You could easily stay for a few days and do a bit of self catering if you wish. The kitchen area was simple but adequate. I think people should be wary of some of these reviews. I am not sure what people expect - maybe Buckingham Palace for under Â£150 a night in central London!

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: pippen07
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on a hen weekend, Large lounge area so all the girls could meet in one from before heading off to see the wizard of oz, Could do with a bit of an update but for the amount of time spent in the room i thought they were find, We had a fridge,kettle and they did supply tea and coffee in the rooms, we even found an ironing board and iron....depends what you are looking for in an appartment but i would stay here again. The staff were friendly and helpful,great location and there is a tesco express just up the road,The rooms were clean and we were happy with that.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location to discover London”
Reviews.Author: Lemzwerg
Reviews.Content: This Aparthotel is perfectly laocated to explore London. Subway access is around the corner and you can easily walk!!!! to Picadilly Circus (Buckingham Palace is at the front door :-)). We were lucky to get an upgrade and had a huge and nicely furnished appartment (living room, bedroom, fully equipped kitchen and bathroom) at a low price. Probably best deal in town!

Reviews.Title: “Great location & big room... however could use a refurb”
Reviews.Author: mitchellroad
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Curzon Plaza aparthotel over New Year, as we wanted to have the flexibility of having a kitchenette, etc. and hotels in the area were extremely expensive. The accomodation was basic but spacious, and provided a convenient crash pad in the centre of Mayfair. We booked a "large one-bedroom apartment" and were pleasantly surprised with almost 700 square feet of space, with a fully fitted kitchen. The apartment was cleaned on a daily basis, although unfortunately tea & coffee were not replenished. On the downside, both the apartment and the common areas are very tired and in need of a refurb, and only one lift was working... so the wait for the lift was a little long at busy times. Overall, Curzon Plaza provides an interesting option for a place to stay in central London, so long as you are not looking for luxury.

Reviews.Title: “Never again!!!!”
Reviews.Author: lazygirl01
Reviews.Content: I would never stay in this accommodation again. Check in was very eventful - receptionist said that he had no reference of our booking - we gave full names and company details etc he still couldnt find us - he then said i have no booking for eg john smith but i have one for smith john - some common sense needed. the receptionist took the card details as a "deposit" and instead of charging the Â£109 plus Â£129 for 2 rooms = Â£238 they took the amount of Â£300 (this wasnt charged, just used as deposit details). when challenged about the amount we were told that this extra cost was for papers we MIGHT have and any telephone calls we MIGHT make!!!!! not something i have ever experienced before. we were then given keys to our rooms - 24 and 148. when i entered my room the stale smell hit me and when i looked around i was less than impressed. The bathroom was very dated and freezing cold with a really bad draft coming from the windows. The furniture through the room was very dated also and the paint was coming off the walls and doors etc The noise of the traffic and busy street below was an issue but i am sure that if the windows were upgraded to double glazing then this would take some of the issue away. The only positive thing about the hotel really was the very comfortable bed. I would not stay at this hotel again

Reviews.Title: “wrong choice,should gone to Travelodge Covent Garden”
Reviews.Author: Chardkran
Reviews.Content: Location very good. That was the only good thing about this hotel. We had no kitchenette as advertised and they would only change our room the following day only when we challenged them at reception. The bed was made and the towels changed daily but no other cleaning took place. Coffee and tea never replaced not even when requested as it is only available on the first day, and our stay was for three nights. Internet access was unusable. Bed linen was not up to standard. The Shower was very weak during our stay which was reported ans was told to leave it running longer but that made no difference at all. It was only replaced on our last night stay. The bedroom was exceptionally hot at night making it difficult to sleep, while the bathroom could have been warmer.

Reviews.Title: “Lots of space but not quite there”
Reviews.Author: djl44
Reviews.Content: Booked this for 2 nights. The studio apartment was big with large bed, settee, chair, and the smallest TV you would find. Kitchen consisted of a fridge microwave and kettle, two cups, 2 wine glasses and 2 other glasses. When I commented on no cutlery or plates reception said I should have asked and they could have provided them for me.(But why were they not in the apartment?). Towels were small and not very good quality. Location excellent but as my room was on the front it was noisy during the night. Staff were lovely, with the man behind reception giving me his newspaper because I hadn't managed to pick one up

Reviews.Title: “good location-bad value for money”
Reviews.Author: g-drako
Reviews.Content: Mayfair is an upmarket location. So you expect the hotel, particularly when you pay high rates. However, the appartments need urgent refurbishment, the quality of linen and equipment is equal to a 2 star hotel. For three days nobody bothered to fix the internet!!! And... for late c/o (17.30) they charge the whole night, without even cleaning the appartment during the last day of stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value, Service, Location and Spacious too.”
Reviews.Author: freebird191205
Reviews.Content: I booked this aparthotel for the location - it was a short walking distance from Green Park tube station and also the theatre, it seemed good value for money too. Me, my mother and teenage son just stayed the one night to enjoy some sightseeing and theatre and wanted a bit more space and flexibility than a hotel alone could offer. After I booked I looked on trip adviser for comments and was dismayed to read so many negative comments. Had I read them first I definately would not have booked it but I am so glad I did because it suited our needs exactly. We booked a deluxe one bedroom apartment and had a large bedroom with super king bed, a large sitting/dining room with extra single bed to one side, a good size separate kitchen with sink, microwave, hob, kettle, toaster and all requisits one would need. The room overlooked the garden and was really quiet, the bed was clean and comfortable, we had a good nights sleep, the windows in the bedroom had blinds and curtains too. There was plenty of space and storage and would be ideal for a longer stay. Our apartment was warm throughout and there was plenty of hot water. The furniture was plain Ikea style but functional and the sofa was comfortable too. The staff were courteous and helpfull. There was an M&S simply food next to Green Park tube station which was very convenient for supplies. On close inspection it probably could do with some redecoration but all things considered I found it to be excellent value for money in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “excellent apartment”
Reviews.Author: lucyco__93
Reviews.Content: we made sure to ask for wooden floors for my daughters asthma. and we were given a large 2 bed . it was sapcious, modern and convienant . ok the corridor and the list wernt the may west . but the location and the aprartment were top notch! only complaint - noise of traffic in the morning. its a busy area !

Reviews.Title: “Horrific Hell Hole of a Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Gracesdad
Reviews.Content: DO NOT STAY HERE UNLESS YOU ARE CONSIDERING EUTHENASIA. The windows don't close, the furniture is dirty and dated. I saw 4 seperare rooms and none of them were more than a hostel standard room. Luckily, I was able to switch hotels last minute and in a great reversal of fortunes secured a 5* Hotel for exactly the same price. Please Wipe Your Feet on the Way Out!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Apartments enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: musicalmad
Reviews.Content: After booking the Curzon I was shocked to see some of the reviews. However, I am so glad we went there. The staff were extremely helpful and took the time to make you feel very welcome. We had booked a basic one bedroom studio but were delighted to have a lounge, large bedroom, bathroom and a small cupboard kitchen. It had everything we wanted including a microwave, toaster, kettle, cutlery and crockery.The Tesco next door was great for provisions for breakfast including fresh croisants. Shopping in Oxford Street is a short walk away and many of the theatres are within easy walking distance. The decor maybe a little dated but everywhere was spotlessly clean. The view from the top floor was great and we will most certainly be going back again.

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT STAY IN THIS HOLE”
Reviews.Author: PeterM091
Reviews.Content: This hole of a hotel/apartment is 5 minuites from where i work. I late booked last week and stayed 2 nights. Its truly dreadful. Avoid at all costs. Nothing going for it except the location. Frankly for the price its a rip off.

Reviews.Title: “What you see is NOT what you get”
Reviews.Author: Slarti65
Reviews.Content: The pictures on the website have nothing to do with reality. I booked 2 double rooms, one of them an ordinary apartment, and the other a studio. There was no real difference between them, other than the price. Both were were equally poor and depressing. In one apartment, the living room had not a single picture on the light-brown painted walls. Sleeping room was towards Bolton Str. Both the living room and the seleeping room had one window that could not be closed completely, and there is constant traffic in that street, so sleeping quality was non-existent. Very hard madrasses. Kitchenette was absolutely basic on 0,5 sqm, I felt like on a camping tour. The other apartment had a sleeping room towards the backyard, with constant noise from a kind of ventilation. Location is excellent, with Piccadilly Circus and Leicester Sq within walking distance. Been there for 6 nights, but would not book it again, rather pay a bit more and book the Holiday Inn which is just around the corner.

Reviews.Title: “its a flea pit”
Reviews.Author: millydan
Reviews.Content: although the location is very good, and the staff were charming this hotel was dirty and smelt of black tobacco. there were a number of gentlemen wondering around the hotel without any shoes on and sitting around the foyer....very odd. luckily as we went to see stevie wonder, i was too drunk to care where i slept!

Reviews.Title: “Good enough for money”
Reviews.Author: Noricco
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel as a part of Eurostar package from Paris for the value for money, knowing the bad reviews here. Having requested in advance for the comfortable stay, one of our rooms was upgraded to spacious two bed room flat and it was really huge like an American condo. As we were Londoners before, we did not care much about the old lifts and building, which do not , as others stated, look like their photos on their website. We enjoyed the stay. A newly refurbished flat in a good location could cost 150GBP/night in the similar location. This apartment is really good enough for what we paid.

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay here - the photos are lying”
Reviews.Author: benneps
Reviews.Content: Do not believe the photos or quotes. The "full size" kitchens are wardrobes, some of the rooms on the road side are so loud it's impossible to sleep and I do not know how they get away with calling it a "luxury" hotel. I would say it is very average. I had a load of washing done in house which cost GBP60 (!!!) but, fair enough, it is Mayfair. However, 4 items were badly damaged and one totally destroyed. Finally, I got a refund of the cost of getting the destroyed sweater "cleaned" but nothing to replace the sweater. I had washed it numerous times with no issues but when it came back from Curzon it was totally out of shape & stretched beyond belief. They said it was to do with the age of the fabric and the wear of the fibres. They said they could take it further if I was willing to pay to have it professionally examined. Fabulous location but everything else is sub standard - what a bad taste it left in my mouth and it's 12 months on!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: Cjay05
Reviews.Content: Arrived very early at the Curzon Plaza and staff were more than happy to check us in early. Rooms were extremley clean. Staff very very helpful. Tesco express 2 minute walk from Plaza, Tube Station/St. James Park/Buckingham palace all within walking distance, The tube station and the park are only 2/3 minutes walk. Mayfair is very nice upper class area so the price was very reasonable for this area. Very near to Hyde Park for Concert goers. Only complaint is the shower in the room. Water was way too hot and the dial to adjust the temperature didn't seem to work, Shower was either at boiling point or verging on freezing.

Reviews.Title: “great location, good staff, but be prepared its not quite like the website”
Reviews.Author: purplefoxy1
Reviews.Content: We booked this a month or so before our trip with the hope of securing an upgrade if available to a 1 bed suite from a studio. On arrival the entrance doors and reception were quite tired and not as modern and fresh as portrayed in the website photo, however reception staff very friendly and we were told we had upgrade to a 2 bed apartment - result! we took lift to our room on first floor - the lift was in really shabby condition , we reached the corridor our room was on (rm 29) right at the end and with every step my heart was sinking, the carpet was grotty and the room doors looked progressively worse. We reached our apartment the plus's a great size very spacious lots of room (i'm trying to be positive - I know its the same point 3 ways) the kitchen living area was actually ok - great to have fridge & kettle etc however the area was very tired - we had curtains that didn't reach across the whole window which meant we could see in the offices across the road and they could see into our room - also the sofa and carpet were quite grubby - i didn't feel that i could relax properly in the space. the bathroom was nothing like the one featured on the website - well to be fair it was a similar shape. The tiles I think dated back to 1970 (i remember having similar ones in a home we moved to in 1978) the shower did not fit to the wall - had to phone to get it fixed, generally the space was tired, having a shower was not an enjoyable experience. the bedrooms were a good size with lots of hanging space - but no duvet's and whilst bedding was very clean , again the carpet looked and felt a bit grubby and general decor all felt very tired and place generally could do with a deep steam clean. no full length mirror and no plug point near a mirror The location of the plaza was hard to beat due to its close proximity to the tube and our favourite shops as well as being a stones through from the tourist bus and green park - we were simply disappointed with what we feel is misleading advertising on the website - we booked the plaza specifically because it looked modern and clean. (we normally stay at places like the City Inn Westminster) but for this trip needed to be near Green Park and liked the idea of an apartment. At one point the lock on our door broke and we couldn't leave the room! not ideal having to wait to get out and could have been a disaster in event of a fire to be fair though this and the shower issue were attended to quickly by friendly staff its a shame they are let down by very tired accommodation - this place would be a real haven with a few small improvements and upgrades. on balance if you got the rooms for less than Â£90 then it's probably worth staying there, we simply feel that for the money we paid that we were 'had'. We'd have been happier with a nicely fitted out studio rather than a grotty 2 bed apt.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: WallaceandGromit_10
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews, we were hesitant about staying here, but we loved it! We got a two bedroom two bath apartment and it was perfect for us. It was clean, the water did get hot (other reviewers said it was always lukewarm), the sheets were clean. The staff were so helpful and friendly. The location is perfect. There is a tescos and a Marks and Spencer near by. One other thing- we were in London during the volcanic ash chaos, and Curzon Plaza were very accomodating and helpful to us during our extra days there. We would stay there again in a second!

Reviews.Title: “Truly, Truly awful - do not even consider staying here, it is a dump!”
Reviews.Author: Jamapy71
Reviews.Content: This so -called 'apart-hotel' is an absolute disgrace - we were allocated a one bedroom apartment, and looking at pictures on both the hotels' own, and various booking agent wbesites, we were fairly confident of a comfortable stay here - HOW WRONG COULD WE BE - The place is awful, bathroom was filthy with mould growing out the sink, the bath panel was mouldy and hanging off, floor tiles cracked and full of filth. The excuse for a 'kitchenette' is hard to actually locate it is that small, with a mouldy stinking fridge and a grubby, smelly sofa to sit on. I would also question security at this hotel - adjoining rooms are just a wafer thin door apart with paper stuffed in the keyhole!! We have NEVER seen anything this bad - even in London so please, please find somewhere else, do not be fooled by the glossy pictures like we were.

Reviews.Title: “luxurious yet affordable”
Reviews.Author: aseemjain
Reviews.Content: i had a great experience staying at the hotel over the Easter weekend. i just couldn't believe the size of the room i got for the price for a place right at the heart of london. All major places like oxford street, piccadlay circus, leicester square, buckingham palace were within 1 mile radius from this hotel. i got a very good deal with 3 nights for price of two and the hotel people were very kind to upgrade my room to one bedroom apartment from studio apartment. the stay was much better than at a B&B as i as not bound to get up or leave early and staying in the apartment itself was very relaxing. i was very happy with the stay and if i really have to be critical, i'll just say i would have preferred some ouchless toilet rolls!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with excellent location”
Reviews.Author: handersson
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Curzon Plaza for three night on March 2010. We looked for hotels about three months and we felt like we are never going to find a hotel that wouldn't cost too much per night. Finally and luckily we found Curzon Plaza. We also found a decent deal from the hotel's webpage: Â£193,88 / 3 nights. We were really happy with the hotel and surprised how nice it actually was. After reading comments of Curzon Plaza from TripAdvisor we got a bit affraid but there was no need to worry. The staff was really nice and helpful, room was cozy and a lot bigger than we expected (bedroom, livingroom, bathroom and kitchenette). Curzon Plaza's location was also brilliant! The excellent location was actually the most important thing for us. We wanted to stay in a hotel that is close to a tube with good connections and also a hotel that is close to Piccadilly Circus. Especially during the night time it was very pleasant that we were able to walk from Soho's restaurant area back to the hotel without worrying about getting a taxi etc. Sure the hotel is a little old and you can see that especially in a hallway but who cares if the room is really nice and you can enjoy your trip in a best possible way. It's not a five star hotel but it definitely isn't a hostel. We can higly recommend Curzon Plaza for everybody who travel to London for leisure. You will get a hotel with excellent location and good tube connections. We think this was a great deal!

Reviews.Title: “It doesn't look like the photos on the web site!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: fitbirdalert
Reviews.Content: Staff very friendly. Location excellent. The apartment was disappointing. In dire need of refurb. The cupboard in the lounge was in fact the kitchen!!!! No oven though so make sure any food you buy is micro wave only. Lots of noise in the early hours from bin men. On the whole it was good value for money and we would stay there again but not for longer than 2 nights.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for!”
Reviews.Author: Goldengirl039
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night in the Curzon Plaza. We booked a studio for Â£69.00 and were updgraded to a one bed on the third floor (Apartment No. 78). We had a dodgy lock on the door but managed to get it open. On entering the apartment it was warm but discovered that the radiator in the bedroom did not work and there was a portable radiator to plug in if we needed it. Bathroom was in dire need of a refurbishment and generally the apartment decor wasn't that good. The lounge had a dog-eared two seater sofa, a coffee table, small tv with Freeview box and a table with two chairs. I couldn't find the kitchenette until I opened a cupboard door in the lounge and there it was! The doors to the unit containing the plates did not close because it wasn't deep enough for the plates. There was a fridge, toaster, microwave, kettle and a small sink. There was no room in the kitchenette so I had to stand in the doorway to wash up and put the kettle on. Having said that, it was all we needed for one night. Another minus point is that we had no hot water for my husband to shave in so he had to boil up the kettle. The shower was an electric one although it felt like a trickle of water rather than a proper shower. Bed was nice and comfy and was ziplocked twin mattresses. Plenty of storage space in the bedroom for clothes. There were wooden blinds in the bedroom which unfortunately did not close properly so let some light in. When we leaving the apartment, the cleaner was in another one at the end of the corridor by the lifts and we could clearly see that the bathroom had refurbished. On the plus side, the apartment was very spacious, quiet and well located with a Tesco Express a few doors down if you need any provisions. Would I stay here again? Yes, but only because of location and the helpfulness of the staff and I would definitely request a refurbished apartment.

Reviews.Title: “Top Location, Huge Apartments, Kind Staff”
Reviews.Author: Liam22V82
Reviews.Content: Curzon Plaza is a very good 3*** Hotel to stay for more than a coupple of nights. My apt had a bedroom, a wide dining room and a small kitchenette. Having around 40square metres in one of the best hood in London is definitely a great plus. Rooms are not luxurious, they probably need some refurbishment since the heating system doesn't always work perfectly and the windows are quite spartan. Staff is great, helpful and kind and made the whole experience better. I'd definitely suggest staying there to my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value for Location”
Reviews.Author: Sandie-NY
Reviews.Content: The Curzon Plaza is in an unbeatable location near the Green Park tube station. It is close to Shepherd's Market with great restaurants and pubs. We have stayed many times in the Shepherd's Market location. The serviced flat we stayed at for the last 10 years reached L200 which we no longer wanted to spend. (I had worked in London and the company paid for the flat). I read the mixed reviews on trip advisor concerning Curzon Plaza and decided to give it a go. I will confess in my reservation I requested a renovated one bedroom and that is exactly what we received. It has new wood floors throughout except for the sparkly black marble in the entrance and bath. The bath is grey marble. There is a galley kitchen with a fridge, microwave, 2-burners, coffee maker and toaster. Very compact but I do not cook. The two rooms, lounge and bedroom are spacious and bright. The rooms are sparse, the lounge with only a table and two chairs, a sofa and a coffee table and the bedroom with a bed and two tables. It is very clean. The price is right. I booked on Curzon Plaza website and took advantage of its special for L89 per might. Would I pay L200? NO. Would I pay L125 probably particularly in high season. You would pay a great deal more for an infamous London nun's room for a hotel room. This is excellent value for the money and location.

Reviews.Title: “excellent location in central location”
Reviews.Author: mrandmrsgrowler
Reviews.Content: The apartments cannot be described as luxury in any sense of the word, but it fulfilled our requirements for the weekend. We booked a studio apartment and were upgraded on arrival to a large 1 bedroom apartment, which was almost as big as our house! Furnishing is sparse and cheap Ikea-type stuff, which looks worn and shabby but was clean and functional. The curtains in the bedroom were unlined so allowed the light in, and there was no blind up in the bathroom (of a groundfloor apartment, facing in on other apartments etc). We stayed on the coldest weekend the UK has seen for 30 years, and the heating couldn't cope. Only one radiator in the living room worked, and the bedroom radiators were only lukewarm, and there was no heating at all in the bathroom (which was freezing). Thankfully there was a portable oil-filled radiator that we moved from room to room as needed. We have stayed at the hotels in Mayfair on other occasions and have never used the facilities such as bar and gym due to time constraints when visiting, so we didn't miss having them at our disposal. Would recommend Katie's Cafe (a few doors down) for a good breakfast rather than the over priced places in Shepherds Market.

Reviews.Title: “Its true, that you get what you pay for!!!”
Reviews.Author: leeloveridge
Reviews.Content: Booked a large 1 bedroom apartment, but when checking in we found that instead of having a queen size bed as advertised we had 2 single beds pushed together, this was a nightmare trying to sleep in with the beds continously moving apart throughout the night, we was right by the front of the hotel overlooking the road, where you can hear the cars, people etc going past. The bathroom and shower were something i would of expected in a cheap b&b and the kitchen was basically a cupboard, how you could cook anything in there i do not know. All in all i will not ever stay here again, which is a shame as it is a great location.

Reviews.Title: “No Frill;s, no nothing”
Reviews.Author: UkSwiss
Reviews.Content: I wasn't impressed with the place, although the rooms were big for London, it is very run down, and there are absolutley no amenities at all. As some of the reviews say if it's "been rerfurbished" they best start again!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location at Reasonable Price - No Car Required”
Reviews.Author: AvonColoradoGirl
Reviews.Content: We were two blocks from the London subway and less distance to the bus tour stops. Walking distance to lots of fine dining, shopping, and sightseeing. The surrounding area is very posh and high-end. We were very happy with the location and the price was good. The apartment was outdated but clean with plenty of space and wireless internet. The view was of an interior "courtyard" but not at all scenic. Wood panelling on tub really showed the age of the decor. We would try other options in this area and price range first, but would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A Real Mixed Bag”
Reviews.Author: mwhill
Reviews.Content: OK, this one really is a mixed bag. Let me start with the negatives. This place is no frills, and the furniture is a bit worn. Could have used some curtains (in addition to the venetian blinds) in the bedroom to block the morning light.. There is no coffee maker, but there are facilities for instant coffee and that worked out OK. The water pressure in the shower was the worst of our two week trip to England. The floors (and hence the ceiling below the floor above us) were very creaky, and did bother us quite a bit. However - the apartment was HUGE! The portable AC unit in the living room, though a bit disconcerting at first, actually worked well to cool the entire apartment.. We had a room overlooking the interior courtyard which made the room fairly quiet from city noise (except for the planes from Heathrow and the creaking upstairs).. The kitchen was fairly large for an accommodation such as this with a mini-fridge, microwave, and cooktop and a good selection of pots, pans,and dishes (if you desire to cook while in London). The location - 1 1/2 blocks from the Green Park tube station - cannot be beat! And the staff was very pleasant throughtout our entire stay. While it is not inexpensive, it is a fairly good value for London and I would probably stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “nothing like its website pictures - tatty and outdated”
Reviews.Author: Islandangel44
Reviews.Content: I was very disappointed to see our appartment - nothing like the cool website pictures. The bathroom was at least 20 years old with a hideous blue suite, blue pattern tiles, and decades of filth in the grouting. Bedroom has also not been refurbished in at least 10 years - carpet was very dirty. The kitchen consisted of a sink, 2 rings, fridge and microwave. SO small I got an electric shock due to water from the sink when using the micropwave 3 cm away (can that comply with safety regulations?). The living room was OK - laminate flooring, but sofa was old and in need of cleaning. What I did like: we had back facing room (no 58) so it was totally quiet . It was generally very clean (despite grubby carpet, sofa and bathroom grout in tiles). It was a reasonable size and much more spacious than one room. The location was fantastic. I would never stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and not cheerful.....”
Reviews.Author: Paupow
Reviews.Content: Please do not be fooled, the rooms are not as advertised on their website. You could say I was the fool, cheap price in Mayfair should have said it all!!! Our friends had to change their rooms twice, due to smell and general condition of room. We would not have booked if their webiste advertised the rooms we stayed in, very dated (70's) style. If you want budget and do not mind the asthetics then this is reasonably priced and value for money. BEWARE!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Dated and Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: McHaggis69
Reviews.Content: I'm writing this review from room 41 in the Curzon Plaza. Here on a single night business trip and it seemed that given the price was similar to a hotel in this location I thought an apartment would be cool. As others have said though, don't let the Curzon Plaza website fool you. The rooms are incredibly dated and very poorly decorated. Sparse furniture and old steel single glazed windows that either wont open or wont close. The 'kitchen' is like something from the early 70's and is, in effect, just like an old fashioned scullery. I've tried to be fair when scoring - the location is great... its hard to see if the rooms are clean as the actual fixtures and fittings, tiles etc are just so old. The whole place needs a multimillion pound facelift, but then again, if they did that you would pay triple for the privilege of staying here. Basically just scabby old flats in a good location.

Reviews.Title: “Won't Stay Again!”
Reviews.Author: Harriet0924
Reviews.Content: Due to the various short trips we were making, we had used this hotel as the base and stayed in four different rooms (studio, one bedroom, two bedrooms and three bedrooms) in this apartment. I agree totally with the negative comments made by the others. The rooms are dreadful, dirty and old. Don't be fool by the hotel photos. They were nothing like that. There was one night we stayed in this three bedrooms apartment which was facing Curzon St. The windows could not be closed properly and we had no sleep at all as it was so noisy. We told the reception that when we checked in the day after, don't put us back in the same room. And you know what .. they just did exactly what you did not want to happen - the same room! And we did not like about the fact that the receptionist lied to us telling us that the check in time should be 3:00 while the confirmation slip clearly stated 2:00. I suspected that the room was not ready, so he made up something that the policy was changed. The only good point about this hotel is the location, other than that, nothing!

Reviews.Title: “Would stay again, excellent value considering location”
Reviews.Author: Tripper989
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Curzon Plaza for 3 nights, although the decor is dated the rooms are very clean and the staff very welcoming. I had a studio room on the 2nd floor which had a small kitchenette with a fridge, microwave toaster etc which again were all very clean and for the price was more than I was expecting. Huge bed with quality bedding and a nice matteress. The only negative for me was the windows, they looked to be the orignal 1930's windows which didn't fit well and did nothing to minimise the London noise, they need ripped out and replaced with good quality UPVC and it would be so much improved.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty,dirty , dirty !!!!”
Reviews.Author: bibibieber
Reviews.Content: DonÂ´t ...very dirty...very simple....big rooms, good location, but never again...not for that money

Reviews.Title: “Filthy place”
Reviews.Author: bluepearlpoet
Reviews.Content: This hotel is filthy and disgusting. My husband and I arrived at 9:00PM and were immediately put off by the seedy looking people slouching around outside smoking. The lobby was small and not very clean. Our room was on the 6th floor where the carpets in the hall were stained and smelly. The doors are not framed so the only way to keep them closed is to lock them from the insidewith the key. There are no fire doors, the walls in the hall are made of plywood, and the windows in the roms open about 2". These are casements, and one of the windows in our room was painted shut and did not open at all. What a fire trap. The kitchenette was in a converted closet, too small to even boil water. The sofa in the seating area was filthy and covered with stains. The bath room tile was cracked and the tub rusty. The whole place had the ambience of a welfare hotel, thoroughly disgusting. Can nothing be done about a place like this that shows internet photos not at all consistent with the reality? We left immediately and were charged for 2 nights!!

Reviews.Title: “Don't go by the photos!!”
Reviews.Author: SwannyDunstable
Reviews.Content: Booked through laterooms, I would have been furious if I'd paid full price. The apartment was huge, with two bedrooms and two bathrooms, but the shabby 70s decor was awful and the bathroom suites dark brown and very grimy. Nothing like the pictures on the website - I wish I'd taken my camera! However, for the price I paid it was ok, and the location in mayfair was great. On checkout I was told they were planning a big refurb this year, so if that goes ahead it would be quite a good find.

Reviews.Title: “Like this hotel”
Reviews.Author: sarahdudu
Reviews.Content: i stay in the hotel for 4 nights .it was clean with a very good location. if you are coming to travel in london so this hotel is very good.

Reviews.Title: “so disappointing!!”
Reviews.Author: tommythomson
Reviews.Content: our daughter booked this as part of her ruby wedding present to us . I really don,t have the heart to tell her that what looked exceptional in the publicity leaflets was in fact a very run down and poorly equiped rip off . First impressions were good with a clean and relatively modern entrance area . the staff were very friendly (the only saving grace apart from the location) but the room was furnished from a 70s style 2nd hand shop.Everything was just so cheap and nasty. The secondary double glazing was useless and as the windows would not close properly we were kept awake all night by traffic noise. There were water stains on the lounge ceiling the paint they used on the walls was so thin it did nothing to disguise all the stains it was intended to cover.Luckily the bed was lovely/large and clean but NEVER AGAIN in the CURZON PLAZA .

Reviews.Title: “Not a luxury experience, but not bad”
Reviews.Author: YMOParis
Reviews.Content: I saw some of the negative reviews after I booked the hotel and got a bit nervous. There were problems, but none that weren't tolerable for a few days. Some of the previous reviews mentioned the hotel being dirty. I found that it was older - carpets are well worn, fixtures and windows are old and show signs of wear - but not dirty. There weren't any strange smells, corners were free of dust or dirt, sheets and blankets had fuzz balls, but were clean. The carpeting in the hallways could stand to be replaced, but does look well tended. The location is amazing. A very quick walk from the Green Park tube, it's convenient to several lines, and you can get almost anywhere in London on less than one transfer. Within walking distance you have the stores on Bond Street, Oxford Circus and plenty of attractions. In addition to the Tesco, there's a Marks & Spencer's food store across from the Green Park tube that has lots of good things you can pick up to take advantage of the kitchen. I had a studio, which was carpeted and spacious. The bathroom was obviously older, the drain was ridiculously slow in the shower, and there were cracks in the tiling at the edge of the shower. Despite the age, it was clean and aside from the slow drain I had no issue showering there (no mold, residue or general bathroom nastiness). The bed was sufficiently comfortable and there was enough space to spread out my laptop and documents. I will agree with those who noted that the hotel hallway and rooms are very hot. I actually prefer a very warm room, so this was a plus for me. As other reviews have noted, the windows are a bit old, so I suspect this is to negate any drafts that may come from having uninsulated windows. One of the big reasons I chose this hotel was for the free wi-fi. Unfortunately it was pretty bad for most of the trip. I never got a strong signal, and it kept fading in and out when there was a signal. Finally, the keys used at the property are very old fashioned. "For security" they ask you to leave your key at the front desk when you leave. For convenience, they really should invest in an electronic key system. A bit of an annoyance to do this every time you want to pop out. Now even though the accommodations aren't top of the line, the people at the desk were. I mentioned the wifi being weak, but when I brought it up they offered to restart the router pretty frequently. When I asked for directions to a store, they were quick to print a map and give directions from the hotel. The welcome was a bit long for my tastes, but for someone visiting London for the first time, probably helpful. All in all, a generally pleasant and helpful staff. At some of the rates mentioned, I can understand why there might be some disappointment. I paid a little over $120/night, and for the size of the room, location of the hotel and kitchenette think it was a good deal. I was expecting a 3 star location, and it delivered on that. If the property wants to charge luxury prices (they definitely have the location), they should probably do a floor by floor renovation - electronic keycards, new carpets, replace windows, include more modern bathroom fixtures and tiles, new bed linens. But for a clean place to stay in an excellent location at a reasonable price, I would stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Curzon Plaza”
Reviews.Author: GeordieR
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Curzon Plaza last year from September - November on business, spending between 3 and 4 nights there each week. Before staying there, I spent another two months staying at hotels in and around the central London area. I think I know what I am talking about! First thing's first. The Curzon Plaza is not a hotel. It is an aparthotel, which means from my experience that your room comes with at the most basic a ktchenette if not a fully equipped kitchen. Throw in a real, good-sized bathroom, and you are looking at considerably more livng space than any London hotel room. Believe me there is only so much hotel and restaurant food anyone can eat, and with a small Tesco on the corner, it's great to actually be able to prepare even the simplest meal in your "own" kitchen. Also on features - when it comes to plentiful hot water and powerful showers - in my experience the Curzon Plaza cannot be beaten. However, a word of warning - the bathrooms are a wonderful collection of teh original 'seventies suites from plain white, to orange, to avocado. Devotees of Elle Decoration should love them! And they are spotlessly clean! The bathrooms that is, not the readers... Lets look at the cost. We're talking Mayfair here - an easy stroll (yes minutes, not hours) from Berkeley Square, Bond Street, Regent Street etc. I challenge anyone to find a room rate as good as those at the Curzon Plaza in central in Mayfair! The place is spotless, with the best hotel beds in London. They are big, new, firm and clean. The linen and towels are equally so. Room service here is to be commended, they run a very tight and clean ship. And on the decor front - this admittedly is a tad eccentric. This is an art deco apartment block which is looking tired, but has some wondeful deco features. And the neutral Magnolia and laminate flooring throughout every room will not be to everyone's taste. But it is fresh and clean, and inoffensive. And it certainly is not worn frock or faded wallpaper! Finally, the front of house desk were always fantastic. Warm, friendly and incredibly efficient. A real asset to the Curzon Plaza and themselves. In short, give Curzon Plaza a go. Facilities, cleanliness, location and rate. You will be hard-pushed to find anywhere as good!

Reviews.Title: “Ideally located for Picadilly and Mayfair”
Reviews.Author: htracyhutch
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have just returned from a one night stay at the Curzon Plaza. the purpose of our trip was my work Christmas Party. The photos's of the Serviced Apartments shown on the website left me filled with excitement and I cooed all day to my colleagues about the luxury pad we would be staying in. How wrong could I be. When we arrived and checked in (we had prepaid for the room), the reception area looked comfortable and was nicely decorated for Christmas. We were pleased that the location was only 10 minutes walk from the party venue. We got in the lift to the 4th Floor. Our room was opposite the lift door (which was to be a problem later on in the evening with the comings and goings of other guests). First impressions were not good but we put on a smiley face and thought "it's only 1 night". The lounge was basic, the kitchen about 5ft x 3ft and the cooker didn't work. The bathroom was very old fashioned but the shower curtain was clean as were the towels. However, when we began to get ready to go out there was no hot water . It took 10 minutes to get luke warm and we then shared it just in case we couldn't get any more! The bed was comfortable (and modern) and the sheets were clean but it was obvious that the rooms had been decorated as a rush job as there were paint splashes over the plug sockets and light fittings. All in all a forgettable experience and one that we will not be having again. I would not recommend these apartments to anyone and they were definitely not worth the Â£130 we paid!

Reviews.Title: “Not too bad”
Reviews.Author: Hunter28
Reviews.Content: I travelled for business mid October and stayed at a 5 star property in the area and really fancied the location for a leisure trip planned toward the end of November 2008. Whilst still in London I looked at the companys' own website. I was alarmed as I believe you do always need to worry about a product that has "pictures for representation purposes only" prominantly listed on it's own website. I went in to the building to have a look for myself before booking and can see what they mean. I was shown 6 apartments and they were all differently decorated and varied considerably from one another and the pictures on the website. The staff member showing me the apartments explained that many of the apartments were privately owned at some stage and when the current owners took over there has been minimal work to the apartments but plans are in place for a refurbishment in 2009. Too right the building needs a refurbishment but it is clean (age of furnishings etc can give a dirty feel), comfortable and conveniently located so I decided to make the reservation. We arrived early morning but were offered the apartment which turned out to be one of the â€œnicerâ€� ones as I found little fault with it and it looked much like the pictures on the website. Considering the cheap price paid for a the 4 of us, the great service and the fantastic location I will be back . . . . .

Reviews.Title: “Scary !”
Reviews.Author: mylolisbon
Reviews.Content: Beware of the very deceptive pictures that appear on the hotel's webpage. The apartment was so bad , we immediatelly went out to look for another place to stay. As it was past 2pm ,even though we ended up not sleeping even 1 night, they made us pay for 2 nights - this is incredibly unfair as the photos and description of the place are totally misleading . Everything looked old,carpet in corridor was dirty and all rundown.

Reviews.Title: “Tatty, but a very good location”
Reviews.Author: andyg7
Reviews.Content: I spent one night at the Curzon Plaza whilst in London for work, it was not a pleasant experience. I stayed in a studio on the ground floor. The door to the room didn't feel secure, the lock was very loose and the door itself very thin and rickety. The room was tatty, the walls had telephone wires running all over, and the kitchen had cupboards with broken doors etc. The bathroom was the rooms only saving grace, being clean and functional. The problem with this hotel is that from the outside it looks luxurious and upmarket, this creates high expections for the rooms. Which are in reality dirty, worn and in need of refurbishment. The best assett this hotel has is its location, but I would not reccomend this hotel to anybody, spend a little extra elsewhere and get a lot more out of your trip.

Reviews.Title: “Utter toilet”
Reviews.Author: Zzzzzzzzzzzzzzzz
Reviews.Content: Do not even consider staying at this overpriced hovel. The website is a complete lie. The rooms are extremely tired, dirty and uncomfortable. The windows are so old and badly maintained that they do not even shut which makes for a very noisy experience. I hardly slept a wink the night I stayed there due to the traffic noise, shouting and deliveries outside. Upon complaining I was told the Manager would be in touch - he didn't even have the decency to contact me. Stay away!

Reviews.Title: “Mutton dressed as lamb”
Reviews.Author: Prenno
Reviews.Content: First the positives. The Curzon Plaza is wonderfully situated in the heart of Mayfair, with excellent restaurants/pubs a very short walk away, a Tesco Metro and Cafe Nero on the next corner and loads of tourist attractions within easy walking distance. The rooms are big, spacious and well appointed and the staff very friendly. BUT . . . . The Curzon seems to be situated right on the corner of the main cut through from Piccadilly to Park Lane and the rooms are not double glazed. Therefore any kind of sleep at night is well nigh impossible thanks to the constant rumble of traffic (and we were quite a way up on the fourth floor). Of course the hotel can't really do much about that, but my wife was distraught to find a cockroach in the bathroom in the middle of the night!!! (As indeed was the individual who had to dispose of it. ) ME! No sooner had she recovered from that shock than she found an appalling looking brown stain right in the middle of the bath towel. Fortunately, on closer inspection, this turned out to be nothing more sinister than a burn mark, but it was still disconcerting. The kitchen of the apartment also smelled of stale cigarette smoke, which is presumably where the offending mark originated. The exterior of the building looked a little shabby with some of the windows cracked, which filled my wife with a sense of foreboding before we even entered the building. Sadly that sensation proved accurate. At Â£269 for a night the Curzon appears to offer reasonable value for a family of four, but we were hoping for a little more for our money. If you don't have a visa card you have to pay Â£50 on your debit card as an up front deposit, but this is refunded when you check out so isn't really a problem. The Curzon looks, on the surface, modern, well appointed and plush. But scratch beneath the surface and it's really not all it cracks up to be. All in all, disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty - Avoid - Found a condom wrapper in the bed!”
Reviews.Author: ARWManchester
Reviews.Content: Mayfair may be upmarket, but this hotel is not! Big problem is that the rooms are NOT clean. Everything seems to have a layer of grease on it - even the coat hangers and remote control! Told myself to "deal with it" but then upon finding a condom wrapper in the bed, thought my initial negative views were warranted. Provided feedback to reception about cleanliness and condom wrapper and they apologised but were not that interested. Also sent an email to the management team but got no reply. Do yourself a favour and avoid this place - there are plenty of other great hotels in Mayfair.

Reviews.Title: “Above average”
Reviews.Author: sandonred
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights and booked a studio direct with the property owners website which was cheaper than any other site. The location is great and really quiet. Green Park tube station is about a 2 minute walk with the victoria, jubilee and picadilly line serviced which makes the West End easy to reach. There is a tesco metro on the next corner that caters for self catering needs. The staff all seemed really friendly and are mainly Polish although they insisted upon a passport which annoyed me when I tried to explain that British people have no need to carry a passport, when the penny finally dropped she wanted a credit card as a deposit for the room (which I also don't have) so my debit card was used and a Â£50 deposit per night meant I had to pay Â£150 for our 3 night stay but this was refunded without fuss. Our studio was spacious and clean and we much preferred this to a hotel room for which you would pay a lot more for in London. The studio consisted of a hallway, bathroom, living area/bedroom and a kitchen all of which were spotless. A TV was provided with freeview and the room had a safe although this wasn't bolted down!!. These apartments are ideal to have your own space in a quiet area but still within easy reach of all the sights. Would use these again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: XJL
Reviews.Content: I booked the 2 bed/2bath apartment for a 1 night stay for a friends 30th, the night before we left for London I found the review page on this website and was a little aprehensive of what to expect, on arriving we asked for an early check in but they were unable to provide this although let us leave our luggage behind the front desk. We went back at 14.30hr (half hour after the stated check in time) and our room was still not ready. We insisted on waiting this time and so finally got into the room at 14.50hr. I was relieved to see the photos on the website were a good representation of the room we had, I wouldn't call them luxury apartments and I would agree they're a little rough around the edges but the space and location was great. Staff were helpful, rooms were very warm! Kitchen was small and basic, hot water was there although it needed running a fair while before it came through. I would stay there again without a doubt, was the cheapest place I found while searching on line so I was expecting it not to be quite so luxurious but it was a great area with plenty to do and in walking distance to Regent and Oxford street with lots going on and taxi's easy to get from a 1 min walk.

Reviews.Title: “We booked again already...”
Reviews.Author: Fam_T
Reviews.Content: We have booked a 2 Bedroom Apartement at the Curzon Plaza for our Family Trip to London. Before we went we saw thecomments below and where considering to cancel the booking. However we did travel to London and stayed at the Curzon Plaza and really enjoed the stay. We had a room where we didn't like (because of stile - not because it was shaby) and mentioned it at reception. The really helpfull staff offered us to move to an other room straight away. The 2nd room we absolutely loved! The location is great and the staff is really helpfull! I guess on here it is one of these places where a lot of people write something down when they didn't like it but never if they do like it! We booked our next trip to the Curzon Plaza already!

Reviews.Title: “Oh dear...........”
Reviews.Author: LollipopHead
Reviews.Content: I work in Berkely Square and the company Christmas party was being held nearby so we wanted a local hotel to stay in for one night. The Curzon Plaza seemed nice from the website and so much cheaper then other hotels in the area. I was surprised at how shabby the room doors were but not as shocked as I was to discover that there was no hot water. We were not able to shower before changing in to our party clothes. In the morning there was still no hot water so we faced a journey home feeling horribly unclean. The bedding was clean but the carpet in the bedroom was quite dirty.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid Staying at the Curzon Plaza”
Reviews.Author: jkarioka
Reviews.Content: This is one of the worst hotel experiences I have had in the past 15 years of hotel travel. While the Hotel is cheaper than most in the area, it really is one of the worst price/value propositions in London. -The hotel is very old and shabby, the PICTURES of individual rooms ARE MISLEADING. -NO hot water. -Dirty bedding. -Charged twice for a newspaper. -Charged an extra night for early checkout. -CHARGED FOR DOUBLE OCCUPANCY EVEN THOUGH I WAS ALONE. -Did not get a wake up call as requested. -Heating barely worked. -Very noisy. -The staff is not helpful and is rude. -The smallest hotel TV I have seen This Hotel doesn't seem very interested in repeat business.

Reviews.Title: “Cockroaches”
Reviews.Author: Gammydodger
Reviews.Content: Looked good in the pictures, location seemed perfect, between the London Hilton at Hyde Park Corner and Berkeley Square. Booking direct was twice the price of the onine offer. Lobby is plush enough, marble, leather and chrome, fitting the description on the wall outside of Luxury Apartments Service was friendly and efficient, changed my room from a street level room to a 3rd floor room - so I got to see two different rooms The property seems to be a converted apartment block that had a mixture of studio, 1 and 2 bedroom apartments. They updated the decor, but not the structure. Our ground floor room had IKEA (or similar furnishings) and the upstairs one had the old fitted wardrobes and old mouldings on the ceilings. It was warm and everything worked, although it was done on a tight budget. Location was indeed perfect. The only problem was that the kitchen came equipped with cockroaches. If you don't mind the extra room guests, it is a passable budget alternative, but certainly not Luxury apartments

Reviews.Title: “we loved it!”
Reviews.Author: FamilyFi
Reviews.Content: We booked the Curzon Plaza on the Internet. We enjoyed the stay and where really surprised about the Hotel especially after some of the reviews. We liked it that much, that we cancelled the follow on booking in the other Hotel and extended the stay at the Curzon Plaza. I can only reccomend this property!

Reviews.Title: “It's Cheap for a Reason”
Reviews.Author: sabs8789
Reviews.Content: Where should we even begin? I wish i could start this off by saying we had a great time..but its quite the contrary. Thank god for a beautiful city---or else we wouldve been outta here a long time ago. Let me start by saying, the stafff....well, they are like satan's minions. This one brunette woman, looks at you as if she has no idea what you're saying and looks like she is depressed..my friend asked her a question..my friend turned and i saw the woman talking about my friend and of course, i made a big scene. Im from Los Angeles, thats what we do. Ok besides the unfriendly, UNINTELLIGENT and UNKNOWLEDGABLE staff....imagine....opening the elevator...with a smell so bad that you have to cover your nose in order to even make it alive to your room. it smells like curry and dirt and old socks. The smell is unlike anythign ive ever smelled. Thank god when you get to the room...the windows, are open at all times. So you can hear the screaming baby, who i guess lives next door or its kidnapped n decided to scream all the freaking time...where you cant even sleep...let alone and try and sleep with the hard mattress. Thats not all folks...the kitchen..dirty silverware. The bathroom...well, is crap. There is no safe. My grandmother in mexico has a newer tv than we do here, and im not kidding. Btw, we are still in the hotel as we are writing this...we are changing the last two days of our stay to somewhere else...the price doesnt even matter anymore. There are flies in the room. They sent us dirty towels--twice. The sheets are stained. The kitchen has dust and dirt everywhere. Its basically not worth ur money.. the pix on the website look beautiful. but then again, you go on myspace and someone claims to look like heather locklear and in reality looks like courtney love. I mean..its your choice. I wish i wouldve read other reviews before staying here. I DO NOT UNDER ANY CIRCUMSTANCE WANNA STAY HERE AGAIn. THE OUTSIDE LOOKS MORE PLEASANT....and im being honest and sincere. hope your trip is lovely, and make sure you visit the tower of london..and westminster abbey (and go on the london eye) Good luck if you stay here..my heart is out to you. Bon Voyage.

HotelInfo.Name: Curzon Plaza
HotelInfo.Address: 56 Curzon Street | Mayfair, London W1Y 7PF, England
